intro: Sisymbrium kermanicum, commonly known as Kerman mustard, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Middle East and Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known mustard plants. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its leaves are pinnately lobed, and it produces slender, cylindrical pods that contain numerous small, round seeds. Sisymbrium kermanicum is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
